resources.string: Amur Regional Local Lore Museum of Novikov-Daurskiy
City Park of Culture and Leisure
River Gun Boat From The Great Patriotic War Times
Pervomaiskiy Park of Culture and Leisure
By far my favorite Chinese cuisine restaurant. Inexpensive and delicious.
Very convenient location and great Chinese food make this place a must-visit restaurant.
This restaurant offers both Japanese and Chinese cuisine and does it well in both cases.
Probably the most famous and respected restaurant in the city. It offers a mix of European and Armenian cuisine.
Even though Kit-chen is located on the outskirts of the city, it’s still quite easy to get to, and the Chinese food there is amazing.
One of my favorite bars in the city that gets even better when you go there with your friends.
Just like all of the bars on this list, it is located in the nightlife center of Blagoveshchensk. Probably the most well known bar in the city.
Despite the fact that 4U Club was opened just about a year ago, it is already became known for its great atmosphere and people.
Newly remodeled bar right in the heart of Blagoveshchensk downtown.
A great bar that also offers delicious European cuisine
The biggest and the most popular Movie Theater/ Concert hall in the city. There are some events hosted almost every day.
The oldest Theater not only in the city but also in the entire region. You can enjoy some great plays for an affordable price.
Even though most of the plays are targeted towards the young audience, the adults can still find something to watch.
The biggest Movie Theater in the Far East of Russia that has total of 12 screens, also offers the widest variety of movies.
Philarmonia is mostly focused on offering instrumental concerts and also occasionally host some signing performances.
One of the smaller movie theaters that, nevertheless, has a great location right in the middle of downtown.
The must-see attraction in the city, that offers the great views of the Chinese side. It\'s the place the city is known for.
The original Arch was finished in 1891 and then destroyed by the flood. The one that you can see now is an exact copy finished in 2005.
The biggest museum in the region. You can find a lot of interesting information about the history of the city here.
Whether you are religious or not this Cathedral is worth visiting just because of its architectural beauty.
The most visited park in the city, great place if you want to go for a walk with your friends.
A big monument with a real boat on it, and you can free to climb it and explore it more!
Not as crowded as the City Park, has more land, and a larger number of roller coasters. A great place for those who like being closer to nature.
You can kill two birds with one stone by visiting the Victory Square: you would see both the square and the Triumphal Arch located right next to it.
This museum boast a large exhibition of the paleontological remnants, most of which were discovered locally.
This monument was opened just about a year ago, but had already became a notorious landmark, mainly because of a great view that it offers.
